intro: Coccoloba ilheensis, commonly known as the Ilheus coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the island of Ilheus in Brazil and is adapted to coastal and sandy environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
